intro: Tragia filiformis, commonly known as the slender tragia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and linear, hair-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Tragia filiformis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
